properties.address: Victoria Avenue, Norton, Stockton on Tees Ts20 2QB
properties.description: We are a Church offering food (first come, first served) and conversation. It is a friendly environment for all ages. We have board games, knitting, jigsaws and a whole lot more. It would be great to see you there!
properties.title: Christ Church MIssion

properties.description: We offer free activities for our community based at the Footprints Community Cafe, all groups are aimed at improving wellbeing and decreasing isolation. Come along and do activities you love and meet new people. Activities Schedule; Mondays - The first Monday of each month we hold a neurodivergent social group for both neurodivergence and their parents/carers 1-3pm Tuesdays - Spanish Social Group - Come and learn Spanish from beginners to intermediate. 130-330pm Wednesdays - Every Wednesday is Wellbeing Wednesday, we start with crafts at 930-1130am. Then feel free to stay afterwards for our chatty table and drop in services. Thursdays - Every Thursday morning 930-1130am we have an art workshop for free. Walk ins welcomed. Friday - Jigsaw time - 2-4pm Please contact Chris for more info on 07394871751 or cwpactivities@footprintsinthecommunity.co.uk
properties.title: Community Wellbeing Partnership

properties.description: Based in the grounds of St Mary's Church Horden our weekly cafe which operates from the Centennial Centre is open to all. We are open from 11.30 to 1.30pm every Wednesday and we offer breakfast sandwiches or scones with a cuppa at £3.50 per person.
properties.title: Horden Centennial Centre - Cafe 100

properties.address: St Marys Parish Centre, Norton Green, Stockton on Tees TS20 1DT
properties.description: A friendly & welcoming space with regular talks, warm food & drinks, Parish Nurse surgery, health & wellbeing advice, signposting to multiple support agencies e.g. foodbank, financial advice, bereavement service, counselling & active community groups
properties.title: Norton St Marys Parish Centre

properties.description: Open House is a Navigator North space to take a break, chat with others and take part in creative activities. Based on the ground floor of Dundas House, inside Dundas Shopping Centre. Open House is open Saturdays to March 2026. Open House has step free access, seating and accessible toilet. Everyone welcome. Suitable for all ages. Hot drinks are refreshments are free. With support from Historic England and National Lottery Heritage Fund with Know Your Neighbourhood funding
properties.title: Open House

properties.address: Salters Lane Community Centre, Stockton-on-Tees, TS19 8AF
properties.description: The space is open every Friday from 10am to 12pm with free tea/coffee open to all.

properties.description: We are open to all. Tuesday - Friday (11am until 2pm) Free activities, Free refreshments. Homemade soup and a bun £1

properties.description: At the beginning of May 2024 we will be serving scones, teacakes and a cuppa instead of soup for the summer months. All welcome, come and join us!

properties.description: Pantry open to anyone in need, food items etc available. Also space to sit and chat and have a hot drink

properties.description: Our church space is open to all A warm welcome and a hot drink is available Our community café and Ecoshop is open on on Tuesdays between 10:00 and 13:00

properties.description: Cafe AMALA session, 3rd / 4th Monday of the month (please check) - 3:30pm-4:30pm. Join us for a cuppa tea and some good company. After our Chair Yoga and Exercise session. All welcome, regardless of joining session before.

properties.description: An Energy Hub that has a community room along with a kids table where they can play some games on the available tablets or do some colouring in. We serve hot drinks and run Energy Efficiency workshops, to show how you can save money on your household bills.
properties.title: Utilita Energy Hub (Hartlepool)
